ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Respondent
Notes: 0 = Self/subject; 1 = Mother; 2 = Father; 3 = Other primary caregiver; 4 = Other (describe); 9 = Missing

ElementDescription: Social behavior score
Notes: Total the numeric responses to questions 5-11 and divide by the number of questions in that subset

ElementDescription: Privacy score
Notes: Total the numeric responses to questions 12-14 and divide by the number of questions in that subset

ElementDescription: Sex education score
Notes: Total the numeric responses to questions 15-25 and divide by the number of questions in that subset

ElementDescription: Sexual behavior score
Notes: Total the numeric responses to questions 26-36 and divide by the number of questions in that subset

ElementDescription: Parental/Self concerns score
Notes: Total the numeric responses to questions 37-40 and divide by the number of questions in that subset
